In December 2019, pneumonia cases of unknown etiology were reported in Wuhan district of Hubei Province, China.
1 By January 7, 2020, the causative agent of the disease was identified as the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019‐nCoV).
2 The virus was later renamed as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS‐CoV‐2), and hence the disease was termed coronavirus disease 2019 (Covid‐19).
3 On January 30, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) announced Covid‐19 as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), and 2 months later, on March 11, it was declared as a global pandemic.
